messages.subject: Re:Chicken pox
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/29/2004 6:48:38 AM Eastern Standard Time, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes: I haven t met anybody IRL who speaks of having had
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/29/2004 6:48:38 AM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:
I haven't met anybody IRL who speaks of having had them when "older", so I
have no experience that it is harder, or easier, to deal with then. And do
you mean harder for the parent or for the child? Certainly it is harder for
parents of school age or daycare kids, because the parents miss work until
the child is better.
*************************
I had them when I was almost 30. Horrible, horrible! I don't remember ever
feeling so incredibly sick, totally apart from the itching.
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
